Updated all H1 and H2 font sizes across the CSS file.

**Base styles:**
- `h1`: 32px
- `h2`: 28px

**Specific selectors updated:**
- `.hero-placeholder h1`: 48px → 32px
- `.recent-posts h2`: 32px → 28px
- `.article-header h1`: 42px → 32px
- `.article-content h2`: 32px → 28px
- `.list-header h1`: 42px → 32px
- `.post-item-content h2`: 24px → 28px
- `.site-footer h2`: already 28px (no change)

Mobile versions were already set to 32px for H1, so no changes needed there. All H1 and H2 headings now use 32px and 28px respectively.

Updated the CSS so H1 and H2 font sizes are consistent across all screen sizes.

**Changes made:**
1. Base styles: H1 = 32px, H2 = 28px (already done)
2. All specific selectors updated (already done)
3. Mobile media query (max-width: 768px): Added explicit H1 = 32px and H2 = 28px rules, plus all specific selectors to ensure consistency on mobile devices

H1 and H2 will now be 32px and 28px respectively on desktop, tablet, and mobile. The mobile media query explicitly sets these sizes to prevent any inheritance issues.
